definition: Xue Rengui (614-683) great Tang dynasty general
surname Xue/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
wormwood like grass (classical)
humane/kernel
expensive/noble/precious/(honorific) your

sentences.english: The emperor expressed appreciation to Xue for helping him survive the disaster and awarded Xue with a royal horse.
sentences.chinese: 躲过大难，唐高宗感激薛仁贵，特赐薛仁贵御马一匹。

sentences.english: The emperor expressed appreciation to Xue for helping him survive the disaster and awarded Xue with a royal horse.
sentences.chinese: 躲过大难，唐高宗感激薛仁贵，特赐薛仁贵御马一匹。

definition: Li Jing (570-649 AD), Tang Dynasty general and purported author of "Duke Li of Wei Answering Emperor Taizong of Tang" 唐太宗李衛公問對|唐太宗李卫公问对[Tang2 Tai4 zong1 Li3 Wei4 Gong1 Wen4 dui4], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty
Li Shimin, personal name of second Tang emperor Taizong 唐太宗[Tang2 Tai4 zong1] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Gao Xianzhi or Go Seonji (c. 702-756), Tang dynasty general of Goguryeo 高句麗|高句丽[Gao1 gou1 li2] extraction, active in Central Asia
famous Song dynasty family of warriors (c. 10th century AD), resisted the Liao 遼|辽 and defended the Song/the subject of the popular fiction Yang Saga 楊家將|杨家将
Li Yuan, personal name of first Tang emperor Gaozu 唐高祖[Tang2 Gao1 zu3] (566-635), reigned 618-626
Li Guang (-119 BC), Han dynasty general, nicknamed Flying General 飛將軍|飞将军 and much feared by the Xiongnu 匈奴
Emperor Taizong of Tang, reign name of second Tang emperor Li Shimin 李世民[Li3 Shi4 min2] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
Wang Shichong (-621), general of late Sui and opponent of early Tang
Ma Chao (176-222), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Wei Zheng (580-643), Tang politician and historian, notorious as a critic, editor of History of the Sui Dynasty 隋書|隋书
Turkic ethnic group
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Li Ling (-74 BC), Han dynasty general whose defeat by the Xiongnu 匈奴 in 104 BC led to a major scandal
Yue Fei (1103-1142), Song dynasty patriot and general
